image.altText: A man was caught riding a scissorlift

items.synopsis: An Adelaide man is charged with riding a stolen scissor lift down a popular Adelaide party strip.

title.children: Man charged after allegedly driving stolen scissor lift down Adelaide party street

image.altText: A small brown brick house

items.synopsis: A house vacant for years has put South Australia's police minister in a tough position — either allow it to be rented to public servants, besides police officers, or admit that the town's police station will never reopen.

title.children: There's a housing crisis in this region but police leave this home vacant

image.altText: Police taking pictures at the scene of a fatal crash

items.synopsis: The man's death is the 79th life lost on South Australia's roads this year, compared with 52 at the same time last year.

title.children: Motorcyclist killed after collision with ute in Adelaide Hills

image.altText: A close up image from the side of a man with glasses.

items.synopsis: It’s tucked away in six of Australia’s airports, well hidden from the average traveller. Inside, some of Australia’s most powerful enjoy five-star food and wine as they await their flights. But when you ask about the Chairman’s Lounge, Qantas has no comment.

title.children: ‘We don’t comment on the Chairman’s Lounge’: What Qantas won’t tell you about exclusive club

image.altText: A close up of the head of an eastern brown snake.

items.synopsis: A man has died after attempting to remove a snake that had coiled around his friend's leg in a tragic accident during school celebrations in northern Queensland.

title.children: Man dies from snake bite after trying to uncoil it from friend's leg

image.altText: A woman with a beach behind her, turning her head with her eyes closed and smiling with the sun on her face

items.synopsis: In a world of diet pills and calorie counting, these women are doing things differently. And, while this Fat Camp is mainly about having fun, there's a serious side, too.

title.children: How a humiliating experience in Bali inspired Annette to set up her own tourism group, 'Fat Camp'

image.altText: A close-up of the side of an ambulance

items.synopsis: Ramping is on the rise again in South Australia, with more than 10,000 hours lost while ambulances waited outside the state's major hospitals during winter.

title.children: Latest data shows ramping continues to rise outside SA's emergency departments

image.altText: Flames on the roof of a house

items.synopsis: South Australian fire crews attend three separate house fires, with a house on Gilbert Street in the city extensively damaged, along with a home in Brooklyn Park, while a house at Port Vincent is also completely destroyed.

title.children: Suspicious fire engulfs city house, causing heavy smoke and traffic restrictions

image.altText: A girl and a woman sit at a round table indoors, looking at a laptop screen.

items.synopsis: Literacy standards are rising in schools that emphasise the sounding-out of words, but education systems are divided over the focus on phonics.

title.children: Zoe was three years behind in reading. She caught up when she was taught a different way

image.altText: Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis appear in a video apologising.

items.synopsis: The co-stars of That 70's Show take to Instagram following a backlash over letters they wrote attesting to convicted rapist Danny Masterson's positive traits.

title.children: 'We're sorry': Ashton Kutcher and Mila Kunis apologise for pain caused by support letters for Danny Masterson

image.altText: an aerial view of a bushfire

items.synopsis: Crews have been called in from South Australia and three extra fire bombers are on the ground in Tennant Creek to assist with the out-of-control blaze.

title.children: NT fire crews battle outback bushfire triple the size of the ACT

image.altText: A group of young adults in colourful clothes dancing at the grocery markets.

items.synopsis: For more than a decade, Peter has spent his days getting strangers to dance and sing on their way to work.

title.children: When Peter sees commuters on a train, he sees a dance party

image.altText: A person takes a bite from a hamburger

items.synopsis: Resisting temptation in the modern world feels almost like a superpower in our modern world. But how does it work? And can anyone learn to do it?

title.children: Temptation is everywhere we look. Here's how we can stop returning to self-destructive habits

image.altText: a composite image of a woman standing in hail and a statue covered in hail

items.synopsis: There aren't many flowers left in Shirley Cronk's reigning competition-winning garden after a hail storm tore through it, but there are a few reasons she counts herself lucky.

title.children: Champion gardener Shirley looks on the bright side as hail storm rips through her flowers

image.altText: Colin Barnett wears a collared shirt and blazer pictured in front of limestone pillars

items.synopsis: The former Liberal leader tells the ABC how he will vote in Australia’s Voice to Parliament referendum and why.

title.children: Former WA premier Colin Barnett reveals position on Voice referendum

image.altText: Mid shot of Mark McGowan looking to the distance, wearing a blue shirt.

items.synopsis: The ABC can reveal details of an "extraordinary" phone call by Mark McGowan to the state's independent environmental protection boss in which he claims the former premier pressured him to drop tough new emissions guidelines.

title.children: Mark McGowan pressured EPA boss to drop tough emissions guidelines in 'extraordinary' phone call

image.altText: A shipwreck underwater shot from above, very close to the shoreline in Solomon Islands.

items.synopsis: An estimated 3,800 ships were sunk during the conflict and remain on the Pacific Ocean floor. Many carried thousands of tonnes of oil and unknown quantities of unexploded bombs. As they rust through, experts fear a detrimental impact on the marine environment and local livelihoods.

title.children: 'We were not responsible': Pacific Islanders call on WWII combatants to decontaminate rusting shipwrecks

image.altText: A teenage boy leans against a wall holding a coffee

items.synopsis: Jacob was waiting three years to see a specialist for his extreme pain, but a backlog of patients forced his family to dip into their savings to see a neurosurgeon.

title.children: Jacob collapsed at school from pain. If his parents didn't pay, he'd be waiting three years for a diagnosis

image.altText: An old white man holding a photo of his dead wife. He is sitting on a couch

items.synopsis: Since his partner's death, John's been locked in a lengthy battle with one of Australia's largest funds to get her super paid out. He's not alone, with the country's peak advocacy group calling for an end to lengthy delays and further grief for families.

title.children: Superannuation payout delays throw spotlight on 'harrowing' ordeal for families

image.altText: Smiling boy with light hair, dark undergrowth,  white tee with smiling emojies stands in a kitchen, kids, people working behind.

items.synopsis: Connor is not "good at cooking". But his skills are already helping the community in this small town.

title.children: This town is missing a critical service for its elderly. So a group of teenagers decided to help

image.altText: Hunter Biden, dressed in a suit, is seen outside.

items.synopsis: Hunter Biden's lived a life of troubles and tragedies. While a prosecutor prepares to have him charged, Republicans keep digging into his history as they call for an impeachment inquiry into his president father.

title.children: Family tragedy, leaked nudes and a crack addiction: Hunter Biden can't escape his past

image.altText: Two boys walk through rubble.

items.synopsis: According to the North African country's interior ministry, more than 2,000 people are dead after the quake.

title.children: In pictures: Morocco earthquake kills thousands, reducing homes to rubble as rescue teams search for survivors

image.altText: A person descends towards the entrance of a cave.

items.synopsis: More than 150 rescuers from Türkiye and other nations are part of the operation to rescue the American explorer.

title.children: Rescue operation begins for ill US explorer trapped in Türkiye cave

image.altText: A man in a hat smiles with two small fish hanging from his teeth.

items.synopsis: In another life, Pelican Bob was a cabaret singer and signwriter. But it was making the move to a small coastal town in north Queensland that helped the 78-year-old find his joy.

title.children: He doesn't have a phone or computer, but everyone in this seaside town knows how to find Pelican Bob

image.altText: A composite image featuring two stills from video footage of a man on the floor with his arms raised.

items.synopsis: Australian tennis player Bernard Tomic says the incident happened five or six years ago and he has "no idea" why the video has surfaced now.

title.children: Bernard Tomic breaks silence over video of two men attacking him on Gold Coast

image.altText: A grey Mazda vehicle crashed into a pole.

items.synopsis: Police insist Melbourne is safe after a terrifying CBD incident that claimed a life and injured others and a crime figure was gunned down in broad daylight.

title.children: Man charged with murder over Melbourne CBD incident, police hunt men over separate shooting

image.altText: woman and child stand in middle of photo with a car to the right.

items.synopsis: Home to fewer than 3,000 people, a town in WA's South West has become a growth hotspot for people looking to escape busy city life.

title.children: As families flee the city in search of affordable housing, this town is proving a popular destination

image.altText: Victoria Police logo

items.synopsis: Police say a 15-year-old boy was arrested yesterday and has been charged with numerous offences related to the abduction of a 14-year-old boy in Glen Huntly on Monday.

title.children: Second teen charged over the abduction of boy in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: HMAS Stirling Freedom of Entry Parade in Rockingham.

items.synopsis: With swords drawn and drums beating, sailors from HMAS Stirling Naval Base were stopped in the street by police in theatrical military tradition dating back to medieval times.

title.children: HMAS Stirling celebrated in medieval military parade, as Rockingham prepares for AUKUS submarine role

image.altText: A staff member touches a man's head while he lies in bed.

items.synopsis: The NSW government's funding commitments are part of a raft of announcements ahead of the upcoming state budget on September 19.

title.children: First new hospital to be built in Western Sydney in 40 years as part of $3bn healthcare spend

image.altText: Coco Gauff

items.synopsis: With a raucous home crowd behind her, teenager Coco Gauff storms home to claim the US Open and her first grand slam title.

title.children: 'Thank you to the people who didn't believe in me': Gauff's swipe at critics as teen claims US Open title

image.altText: Juanita Thumbnail

items.synopsis: For the past 21 years, when the cameras start rolling Juanita Phillips has felt at ease. Tonight, she will present the 7pm news bulletin to New South Wales one last time.

title.children: 'The repercussions carried on for years': The stories that left a mark on Juanita Phillips ahead of her final bulletin
